remarks: A closure function which satisfies ~ sscls , ~ clsidm , ~ cls0 , and ~ clsun defines a (unique) topology which it is the closure function on.  (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 1-Feb-2015.)
statement:
istopclsd.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. V ) $.
istopclsd.f $e |- ( ph -> F : ~P B --> ~P B ) $.
istopclsd.e $e |- ( ( ph /\ x C_ B ) -> x C_ ( F ` x ) ) $.
istopclsd.i $e |- ( ( ph /\ x C_ B ) -> ( F ` ( F ` x ) ) = ( F ` x ) ) $.
istopclsd.z $e |- ( ph -> ( F ` (/) ) = (/) ) $.
istopclsd.u $e |- ( ( ph /\ x C_ B /\ y C_ B ) -> ( F ` ( x u. y ) ) = ( ( F ` x ) u. ( F ` y ) ) ) $.
istopclsd.j $e |- J = { z e. ~P B | ( F ` ( B \ z ) ) = ( B \ z ) } $.
istopclsd $p |- ( ph -> ( J e. ( TopOn ` B ) /\ ( cls ` J ) = F ) ) $.
$d B x y z $.
$d F x y z $.
$d J x y $.
$d V x y z $.
$d ph x y z $.
